title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement [INSERT CONTACT METHOD]. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/ code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https:// www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to fishbc
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to fishbc
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to fishbc
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("", fork = TRUE). Install development dependences devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. Begin commit merge messages - indicate user facing changes included NEWS.md. use fledge automatically generate NEWS.md file.

title: Contributing to fishbc
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to fishbc
text: Please note fishbc project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with fishbc
text: Thanks using fishbc! filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible.

title: Getting help with fishbc
text: opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Getting help with fishbc
text: Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty insane ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site.

title: Fishes of British Columbia
text: fishbc R package provides provides raw curated data codes, classification conservation status freshwater fishes British Columbia. Marine fishes added future release. also include raw fish codes BC Conservation Data Centre Government Alberta. contains information licensed Open Government Licence – British Columbia Open Government Licence - Alberta

title: Fishes of British Columbia
text: install latest release CRAN install latest development version GitHub

title: Fishes of British Columbia
text: Get curated freshwater fish BC fish codes. Get common names fish codes.
code: library(tibble) # for tidy printing fishbc::freshwaterfish #> # A tibble: 161 × 18 #>    Code  CommonName  Class Order Family Genus Species Subspecies Species2 Extant #>    <chr> <chr>       <chr> <chr> <chr>  <chr> <chr>   <chr>      <chr>    <lgl>  #>  1 AF    All Fish    <NA>  <NA>  <NA>   <NA>  <NA>    <NA>       <NA>     TRUE   #>  2 SP    Fish Unide… <NA>  <NA>  <NA>   <NA>  <NA>    <NA>       <NA>     TRUE   #>  3 SG    Sturgeon (… Acti… Acip… Acipe… Acip… <NA>    <NA>       <NA>     TRUE   #>  4 GSG   Green Stur… Acti… Acip… Acipe… Acip… mediro… <NA>       <NA>     TRUE   #>  5 WSG   White Stur… Acti… Acip… Acipe… Acip… transm… <NA>       <NA>     TRUE   #>  6 SH    American S… Acti… Clup… Clupe… Alosa sapidi… <NA>       <NA>     TRUE   #>  7 SU    Sucker (Ge… Acti… Cypr… Catos… <NA>  <NA>    <NA>       <NA>     TRUE   #>  8 LSU   Longnose S… Acti… Cypr… Catos… Cato… catost… <NA>       <NA>     TRUE   #>  9 BSU   Bridgelip … Acti… Cypr… Catos… Cato… columb… <NA>       <NA>     TRUE   #> 10 WSU   White Suck… Acti… Cypr… Catos… Cato… commer… <NA>       <NA>     TRUE   #> # ℹ 151 more rows #> # ℹ 8 more variables: Native <lgl>, Marine <lgl>, Yellow <lgl>, Blue <lgl>, #> #   Red <lgl>, CDCode <chr>, ABCode <chr>, Ktunaxa <chr> fishbc::fbc_common_name(c("AF", "WSG", NA, "AF", "NOTACODE")) #> [1] "All Fish"       "White Sturgeon" NA               "All Fish"       #> [5] NA

code: head(ab) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   `Species Common Name`         `Scientific Name`           `Species Code` #>   <chr>                         <chr>                       <chr>          #> 1 AFRICAN JEWELFISH             HEMICHROMIS BIMACULATUS     AFJW           #> 2 ARCTIC CHAR                   SALVELINUS ALPINUS          ARCH           #> 3 ARCTIC GRAYLING               THYMALLUS ARCTICUS          ARGR           #> 4 ARCTIC GRAYLING (BELLY POPLN) THYMALLUS ARCTICUS MONTANUS AGMN           #> 5 ARCTIC LAMPREY                LAMPETRA JAPONICA           ARLM           #> 6 ATHABASCA RAINBOW TROUT       ONCORHYNCHUS MYKISS         ARTR

title: fishbc: Fishes of British Columbia — fishbc-package
text: Maintainer: Evan Amies-Galonski evan@poissonconsulting.ca (ORCID) Authors: Joe Thorley joe@poissonconsulting.ca (ORCID) Nadine Hussein nadine@poissonconsulting.ca (ORCID) contributors: Bronwen Lewis [contributor] Jesse Patterson [contributor] Gordon Oliphant [contributor] Seb Dalgarno [contributor] Simon Norris [contributor] Allan Irvine [contributor] Poisson Consulting [copyright holder, funder] Province British Columbia [copyright holder]

title: BC Fish Data — freshwaterfish
text: Curated data codes, classification conservation status freshwater fishes British Columbia.

title: BC Fish Data — freshwaterfish
text: tbl data frame 16 columns 161 rows: Code character vector unique provincial fish code. CommonName character vector common name. Class character vector class. Order character vector order. Family character vector family. Genus character vector genus. Species character vector species. Subspecies character vector subspecies. Species2 character vector second species hybrid. Extant logical vector indicating whether fishes extant British Columbia. Native logical vector indicating whether fishes native British Columbia. Marine logical vector indicating whether life-stage fishes occur saltwater British Columbia. Yellow logical vector indicating whether fishes yellow listed British Columbia. Blue logical vector indicating whether fishes blue listed British Columbia. Red logical vector indicating whether fishes red listed British Columbia. CDCode character vector specifying BC Conservation Data Centre species code. ABCode character vector specifying AB Fisheries Wildlife Management Information System species code.

title: BC Fish Data — freshwaterfish
text: data includes estuarine fishes excludes non-finned fishes clams.

title: BC Fish Data — freshwaterfish
code: head(freshwaterfish) #> # A tibble: 6 × 17 #>   Code  CommonName   Class Order Family Genus Species Subspecies Species2 Extant #>   <chr> <chr>        <chr> <chr> <chr>  <chr> <chr>   <chr>      <chr>    <lgl>  #> 1 AF    All Fish     NA    NA    NA     NA    NA      NA         NA       TRUE   #> 2 SP    Fish Uniden… NA    NA    NA     NA    NA      NA         NA       TRUE   #> 3 SG    Sturgeon (G… Acti… Acip… Acipe… Acip… NA      NA         NA       TRUE   #> 4 GSG   Green Sturg… Acti… Acip… Acipe… Acip… mediro… NA         NA       TRUE   #> 5 WSG   White Sturg… Acti… Acip… Acipe… Acip… transm… NA         NA       TRUE   #> 6 SH    American Sh… Acti… Clup… Clupe… Alosa sapidi… NA         NA       TRUE   #> # ℹ 7 more variables: Native <lgl>, Marine <lgl>, Yellow <lgl>, Blue <lgl>, #> #   Red <lgl>, CDCode <chr>, ABCode <chr>
